text: Pierre-Marie Rudelle (18 June 1932 - 28 December 2015) was a French trompe-l'Å“il painter. He painted First Lady of the United States Jacqueline Kennedy a pair of doors in her dressing room in the White House. He also worked for Mohammad Reza Pahlavi and Pamela Harriman. He was born in Paris. Rudelle died on 28 December 2015 in Paris, aged 83. ==References== Category:1932 births Category:2015 deaths Category:Artists from Paris Category:French painters
title: Pierre-Marie Rudelle
